p.codeblock: abstract setPlayerOptionInInt(key: string, value: number): number;
abstract setPlayerOptionInInt(key: string, value: number): number;
Future<void> setPlayerOptionInInt({required String key, required int value});
public abstract int SetPlayerOption(string key, int value);

section.p: The media player supports setting options via key and value. The difference between this method and is that the value in this method is of type Int, while in it is of type String. The two cannot be used interchangeably.

The media player supports setting options via key and value. The difference between this method and is that the value in this method is of type Int, while in it is of type String. The two are not interchangeable.

The media player supports setting options using key and value. The difference between this method and is that this method uses an Int type for value, while uses a String type. The two cannot be mixed.

The media player supports setting options via key and value. The difference between this method and is that the value in this method is of type Int, while in it is of type String. The two are not interchangeable.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: Scenarios that require technical preview or special customization features. In general, you do not need to call this method; use the default media player option settings.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Code](https://doc.shengwang.cn/api-ref/rtc/rn/error-code) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
